articles.author: Philip Ball
articles.title: The true story of the birth of the periodic table, 150 years ago
articles.description: Contrary to the myth, Dmitri Mendeleev's great idea didn't come to him in a dream. Here's the real story of the invention and the revolution that followed
articles.content:
Mendeleev’s table of elements wasn’t the first, but it was the best
Pictorial Press Ltd / Alamy Stock Photo
By Philip Ball
DMITRI Mendeleev had a problem. As a professor at the University of St Petersburg in Russia, he was supposed to teach chemistry to st… [+1258 chars]

articles.author: Ruby Prosser Scully
articles.title: Millions of fish have been dying in Australia’s major rivers
articles.description: Shocking scenes of dead fish lining the rivers in the Murray-Darling Basins, the food bowl of Australia, have been blamed on policy failures and mismanagement
articles.content:
Australian fish are dying in their millions
Robert McBride
By Ruby Prosser Scully
Fish have been struggling to breathe and dying by the millions on the banks of Australias largest river system. Experts say that without serious change, it will continue to h… [+2217 chars]

articles.author: Michael Le Page
articles.title: Don't panic about The Uninhabitable Earth, a new book predicting chaos
articles.description: If you read a book painting the very worst-case scenarios about what global warming means for human life you could easily panic. Here’s why you shouldn’t
articles.content:
Ashley Cooper pics / Alamy
By Michael Le Page
Imagine two groups of people setting off for a hike in the extreme heat of Death Valley.
One group is well prepared with plenty of water, sunscreen, maps, fully-charged phones and so on; the other treats it lik… [+230 chars]

articles.author: Michael Le Page
articles.title: Earth could warm by 14°C as growing emissions destroy crucial clouds
articles.description: If greenhouse gas emissions keep rising, a cloud feedback effect could lead to more than 14°C warming above the pre-industrial level
articles.content:
Clouds could trigger a feedback effect
Stocktrek Images, Inc. / Alamy Stock Photo
By Michael Le Page
If we keep burning fossil fuels with reckless abandon, we could trigger a cloud feedback effect that will add 8°C on top of all the warming up to that poin… [+3232 chars]

articles.author: Joshua Howgego
articles.title: The village where more elements were discovered than anywhere else
articles.description: At least four elements were discovered near Ytterby, Sweden, making it the periodic table's most important site and securing the village chemical immortality
articles.content:
Geologist Erik Jonsson hunting for gadolinite, the mineral in which at least seven elements were originally discovered
Joshua Howgego
By Joshua Howgego
If I were a biologist celebrating the anniversary of Charles Darwins theory of evolution, I might be in … [+1214 chars]

articles.author: Donna Lu
articles.title: Picture-editing AI lets you easily alter a celebrity’s face
articles.description: AI can create convincing pictures of fake people, but now they are expert photo editors too
articles.content:
Sunglasses be gone
 Leigh Vogel/Getty
By Donna Lu
Draw a few lines on top of a photo of a face the shape of an eyebrow, say and an AI can turn your sketch into a realistic edit, with no artistic skills required.
Created by Youngjoo Jo and Jongyoul Park at… [+361 chars]

articles.author: Sandrine Ceurstemont
articles.title: Underwater push-ups help hibernating turtles stay alive
articles.description: Turtles have been spotted performing underwater push-ups while hibernating – something that might help them grab enough oxygen to stay alive
articles.content:
Exercise to stay alive
Alessandro Mancini / Alamy Stock Photo
By Sandrine Ceurstemont
Turtles have been spotted performing underwater push-ups while hibernating something that might help them grab enough oxygen to stay alive.

articles.content:
